Class BankAccount

  • java.lang.Object
    • BankAccount
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CheckingAccount, SavingsAccount
    public abstract class BankAccount
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract base class representing a bank account.

    Provides common functionality for all types of bank accounts including:

    • Deposits and withdrawals with transaction logging
    • Money transfers between accounts
    • Interest application
    • Transaction history tracking

    All monetary amounts are in dollars (USD). Subclasses must implement withdrawInternal(double, TransactionType) to define their specific withdrawal rules (e.g., overdraft protection, minimum balance requirements).

    Thread Safety: Deposit and transfer operations are synchronized.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    BankSystem Team
    See Also:
    CheckingAccount, SavingsAccount

    • Constructor Detail

      • BankAccount

        public BankAccount​(java.lang.String accountNumber,
                   java.lang.String owner)
        Constructs a new bank account with the specified account number and owner.

        The account is created with an initial balance of zero and an empty transaction log.

        Parameters:
        accountNumber - the unique identifier for this account (must not be null or empty)
        owner - the name of the account own÷, AccountStatusExceptier (must not be null or empty)
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if accountNumber or owner is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if accountNumber or owner is empty after trimming

      • freezeAccount

        public void freezeAccount​(java.lang.String reason)
        Freezes the account, preventing all financial transactions.

        When frozen, the account cannot perform deposits, withdrawals, or transfers. The account can be unfrozen using unfreezeAccount(String).

        Parameters:
        reason - the reason for freezing the account (e.g., "suspicious activity")

      • unfreezeAccount

        public void unfreezeAccount​(java.lang.String reason)
        Unfreezes a previously frozen account, restoring it to active status.

        After unfreezing, all normal account operations are permitted again.

        Parameters:
        reason - the reason for unfreezing the account (e.g., "verification completed")

      • closeAccount

        public void closeAccount​(java.lang.String reason)
                  throws AccountStatusException
        Closes the account permanently.

        The account balance must be exactly zero before closing. If the balance is positive, all funds must be withdrawn first. If the balance is negative, all debts must be paid off first.

        Once closed, the account cannot be reopened or used for any transactions.

        Parameters:
        reason - the reason for closing the account (e.g., "customer request")
        Throws:
        AccountStatusException - if the account has a non-zero balance

      • printStatement

        public void printStatement()
        Prints a complete account statement to standard output.

        The statement includes:

        • Account owner and number
        • Complete transaction history with timestamps
        • Current account balance

      • transferTo

        public void transferTo​(BankAccount target,
                       double amount)
                throws InvalidAmountException,
                       InsufficientFundsException,
                       AccountStatusException
        Transfers money from this account to another account.

        This operation uses a two-phase commit with automatic rollback:

        1. Withdraws the amount from this account
        2. Deposits the amount into the target account
        3. If deposit fails, automatically returns funds to this account

        Thread-safe: This method is synchronized to prevent concurrent transfers.

        Parameters:
        target - the destination account (must be active and not the same as this account)
        amount - the amount to transfer (must be positive)
        Throws:
        InvalidAmountException - if amount is not positive
        InsufficientFundsException - if this account has insufficient funds
        AccountStatusException - if either account is not active
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if target is the same as this account

      • getTransactionByType

        public java.util.List<Transaction> getTransactionByType​(TransactionType type)
        Retrieves all transactions of a specific type from the transaction log.

        Returns an unmodifiable list containing only transactions matching the specified type (e.g., all deposits, all withdrawals, all fees).

        Parameters:
        type - the transaction type to filter by
        Returns:
        an unmodifiable list of transactions of the specified type

      • applyInterest

        public void applyInterest()
                   throws AccountStatusException
        Applies interest to the account using the central bank's interest rate.

        The interest is calculated as: balance × central bank rate. The resulting amount is deposited as an INTEREST transaction. Interest is only applied if the account is active and the calculated profit is positive.

        Note: SavingsAccount overrides this to use account-specific rates.

        Throws:
        AccountStatusException - if the account is not active

      • applyInterest

        protected void applyInterest​(double interestRate)
                      throws AccountStatusException
        Applies interest to the account using a specific interest rate.

        This protected method is used by subclasses to apply custom interest rates. The interest is calculated as: balance × interestRate. If the result is positive and the account is active, it's added as an INTEREST transaction.

        Parameters:
        interestRate - the interest rate to apply (e.g., 0.05 for 5%)
        Throws:
        AccountStatusException - if the account is not active
